oai_dc:dc.dc:title: New superconducting and magnetic R-T-B-C systems (r=rare earth t=ni, pd)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GUPTA, LC
NAGARAJAN, R
HOSSAIN, Z
MAZUMDAR, C
DHAR, SK
GODART, C
LEVYCLEMENT, C
PADALIA, BD
VIJAYARAGHAVAN, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Our discovery of superconductivity in Y-Ni-B-C system (T-c similar to 12 K) has opened up a new field in superconductivity and magnetism in intermetallics. A brief description of the discovery of these new borocarbide materials is given. We have synthesised NdNi2B2C and GdNi2B2C for the first time and our measurements show that NdNi2B2C (T-m similar to 5 K) and GdNi2B2C (T-m similar to 19 K) undergo magnetic ordering. CeNi2B2C does not exhibit magnetic ordering down to 4.2 K; the magnitude of its magnetic susceptibility is consistent with Ce ions in mixed valence state. We comment on the magnetic properties of the two superconducting materials ErNi2B2C and LuNi2B2C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS,140,2053-2054
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: International Conference on Magnetism - ICM 94 (13th IUPAP Triennial Conference on Magnetism),WARSAW, POLAND,AUG 22-26, 1994
